description.narrative: This project will aim to build coherent scenarios of how e-commerce platforms may help to address the challenges of expanding youth employment in Africa over the next decade. Part 1 of the Digital Commerce+ project made a compelling case for the linkage of digital commerce to employment and also proposed the concept of the iWorker as a framing categorization. Part 2 of this project will disseminate and test that message more widely by preparing a country diagnostic case study, and translating those insights to actionable country level diagnosis and engagement. This work will help to connect the emerging research and knowledge around the employment effects of e-commerce platforms in China and the US with the realities of e-commerce in Africa today. The project will produce information to allow African policy makers to make informed choices about digital commerce as a pathway to job creation.
